23-030CP.summary: Recommendation to hold an election for the position of Chair and Vice Chair of the Citizen Police Complaint Commission for 2023 - 2024.Chair Soto declared the nominations open for Chair.Commissioner Archuleta nominated Chair Soto for Chair of the Citizen Police Complaint Commission.There being no further nominations, Chair Soto declared the nominations Page 1 of 7411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMTHURSDAY, JULY 13, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTESclosed for Chair.A motion was made by Commissioner Archuleta, seconded by Commissioner Ochoa, to approve recommendation to nominate Chair Soto for Chair of the Citizen Police Complaint Commission.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 5 - David Ochoa, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Brent Walmsley, Irma Archuleta and Merry TaheriAbstain: 1 - Michael SotoAbsent: 2 - Rocio Torres and Michele AndersonChair Soto declared the nominations open for Vice Chair.Commissioner Ochoa nominated Commissioner Tehari for Vice Chair of the Citizen Police Complaint Commission.Commissioner Tehari spoke.There being no further nominations, Chair Soto declared the nominations closed for Vice Chair.A motion was made by Commissioner Ochoa, seconded by Chair Soto, to approve recommendation to nominate Commissioner Tehari as Vice Chair of the Citizens Police Complaint Commission.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 6 - David Ochoa, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Brent Walmsley, Irma Archuleta, Michael Soto and Merry TaheriAbsent: 2 - Rocio Torres and Michele Anderson2.

23-027CP.summary: Recommendation to approve the minutes of the Citizen Police Complaint Commission Regular Meeting of Thursday, June 8, 2023.A motion was made by Commissioner Ochoa, seconded by Commissioner Archuleta, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Page 2 of 7411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMTHURSDAY, JULY 13, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTESYes: 6 - David Ochoa, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Brent Walmsley, Irma Archuleta, Michael Soto and Merry TaheriAbsent: 2 - Rocio Torres and Michele AndersonPUBLIC COMMENT  (5:41 PM)No members of the public addressed the Commission.MANAGER'S REPORT  (5:41 PM)Patrick Weithers, Manager of the CPCC, spoke; and provided the Manager's Report.REMARKS FROM CHAIR AND COMMISSIONERS  (5:42 PM)There were no remarks from the Chair or Commissioners.RECESS TO CLOSED SESSION  (5:42 PM)At 5:42 PM, there being no objection, Chair Soto recessed the meeting to Closed Session.RECONVENE FROM CLOSED SESSION  (8:32 PM)At 8:38 PM, Chair Soto reconvened the meeting.ROLL CALL  (8:32 PM)Irma Archuleta, David Ochoa, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Merry Taheri, Brent Walmsley and Michael Soto   Commissioners Present:Rocio Torres and Michele Anderson   Commissioners Absent:3.

23-028CP.summary: Recommendation to receive Commission's vote and refer findings to the City Manager.Chair Soto reported out from Closed Session the following actions taken:Page 3 of 7411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMTHURSDAY, JULY 13, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTES[1] Case 22-121 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 Improper Arrest, 2 - Use of Force, 3 - Improper Detention, 4 - Unbecoming Conduct, for First and Second Officers accused, 5 - Vehicle Search for First, Second, Third, Fourth, Fifth, and Sixth Officers accused, 6 - Misappropriation of Property, 7 - Sexual Misconduct for Officer accused, and 8 - Misuse of Authority for the Long Beach Police Department;[2] Case No. 22-130 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct, 2 - Unbecoming Conduct, 3 - Unbecoming Conduct, 4 - Failure to Take Action, 5 - Unbecoming Conduct, and 6 - Unbecoming Conduct for First, Second, and Third Officers accused;[3] Case No. 22-126 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Failure to Take Report for the Long Beach Police Department, 2 - Unbecoming Conduct, 3 - Failure to Take Report, and 4 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[4] Case No. 22-119 Commissioners voted 5-1 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct, 2 - Dishonesty, and 3 - Failure to Investigate for First, Second, and Third Officers accused;[5] Case No. 22-116 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Failure to Investigate and 2 - Improper Arrest for Officer accused;[6] Case No. 22-123 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct and 5-1 on Allegation No. 2 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused; [7] Case No. 22-117 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Harassment and 2 - Harassment for Officer Accused;[8] Case No. 22-133 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct and 2 - Bias Based Policing for Officer accused;[9] Case No. 22-118 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[10] Case No. 22-124 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation Nos. 1 - Misuse of Authority and 2 - Misuse of Authority for First and Second Officers accused;Page 4 of 7411 W. OCEAN BOULEVARDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:30 PMTHURSDAY, JULY 13, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCITIZEN POLICE COMPLAINT COMMISSION MINUTES[11] Case No. 22-127 Commissioners voted 4-2 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused.[12] Case No. 22-125 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[13] Case No. 22-122 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused;[14] Case No. 22-137 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Failure to Take Action for Officer accused;[15] Case No. 22-135 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused; and[16] Case No. 22-129 Commissioners voted 6-0 on Allegation No. 1 - Unbecoming Conduct for Officer accused.A motion was made by Commissioner Archuleta, seconded by Commissioner Ochoa, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 6 - David Ochoa, Kenneth Shiozaki-Kawamoto, Brent Walmsley, Irma Archuleta, Michael Soto and Merry TaheriAbsent: 2 - Rocio Torres and Michele Anderson4.
